ai-iti46:1.1_0: For this was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
ai-iti46:2.1_0: “Mendicants, live with training as benefit, with wisdom as overseer, with freedom as core, and with mindfulness as ruler.
ai-iti46:2.2_0: A mendicant who lives in this way can expect one of two results:
ai-iti46:2.3_0: enlightenment in the present life, or if there’s something left over, non-return.”
ai-iti46:3.1_0: “The training fulfilled, not liable to decline,
ai-iti46:3.2_0: overseen by wisdom, seer of rebirth’s end;
ai-iti46:3.3_0: that sage bears their final body;
ai-iti46:3.4_0: He has disposed of Māra, I declare, and gone beyond old age.
ai-iti46:4.1_0: Therefore be always enjoying absorption, immersed in samādhi,
ai-iti46:4.3_0: Having overcome Māra and his armies, mendicants,
ai-iti46:5.1_0: That is what the Buddha has heard.
